citation.article-title: Desulfomusa hansenii gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine propionate-degrading, sulfate-reducing bacterium isolated from Zostera marina roots.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Desulfomusa (De.sul.fo.mu'sa. L. de from; L. n. sulfur sulfur; M.L. n. musa banana; N.L. fem. n. Desulfomusa banana-shaped bacterium that reduces sulfate)
Strain P1T uses sulfate as electron acceptor and reduces it to sulfide.
Propionate is incompletely oxidized to acetate and CO2.
Long-chain fatty acids, acetate and aromatic compounds are not oxidized.
Sulfate, sulfite and elemental sulfur serve as electron acceptors.
A fermentative type of metabolism is not observed. Desulfomusa belongs to the D-Proteobacteria; to date the closest relative is Desulfosarcina variabilis.
According to Rule 20c of the Bacteriological Code (Lapage et al., 1992), Desulfomusa hansenii, the only species, is the type species of the genus.
